projects.name: Alzheimer's Disease Pathology in the Octodon Degus (Degu)

projects.name: Wireless Implant for Studying Alzheimer's Disease Pathology and Cognitive Defects

projects.name: Monosynaptic Rabies Tracing Reveals Sex- and Age-Dependent Dorsal Subiculum Connectivity Alterations in an Alzheimer's Disease Mouse Model
projects.description: Investigated the subiculum of 5xFAD mice, an under-researched region of the brain that shows promising evidence as a potential origin for Alzheimer's disease.
outcomes: Findings showed connectivity shifts in the hippocampus, with age-related changes in visual cortical inputs, adding a layer of complexity to the understanding of Alzheimer's disease.
Shifts in visual input connectivity, not traditionally associated with Alzheimer's pathology, suggest broader vulnerabilities in the disease.

projects.name: How the Forebrain Transitions to Adulthood: Developmental Plasticity Markers in a Long-Lived Rodent
projects.description: Focused on the Octodon Degus (Degu), a social, long-lived rodent endemic to Chile that naturally expresses familial Alzheimer's disease pathology.
outcomes: Observed shifts in perineuronal nets and microglia suggest parallels with human brain plasticity, characterized by windows of adaptability followed by stabilization.
Studying disease mechanisms in a species that mimics human Alzheimer's pathology provides insights that conventional models cannot.

projects.name: Project Design Testing
projects.description: Objective of this project is to develop an innovative glycated albumin monitoring device specifically designed for intermediate-term use in Type II diabetes management. Current solutions, such as daily blood glucose testing and glycated hemoglobin (A1C) assays [1], fail to provide essential insights into the 2-4 week range of glucose fluctuations [3].
technologies: Step 1: Insert blood into the collection module
Step 2: Insert the collection module to the main cartridge
Step 3: Screw in the cap on the collection module
Step 4: Cartridge filters plasma and mixes the solution
Step 5: Mixed plasma passes over electrode, sensing GA concentration
outcomes: Reveals 2-4 week levels [3]
Can monitor gestational diabetes
Higher accuracy and lessened issues compared to other tests
Direct implication as a factor in diabetes complications
Real-time monitoring of glucose levels
Provides detailed data on glucose trends
Reduces the need for frequent fingerstick tests

projects.name: Microfluidic Cartridge with Electrochemical Sensor
projects.description: Addressing limitations in traditional diabetes diagnostics by integrating a microfluidic cartridge with an electrochemical sensor to assess glycated albumin fluctuations over a 2-3 week period
outcomes: Develop a portable, user-friendly diagnostic tool for real-time glycated albumin monitoring
Enhance glycation monitoring as a valuable alternative to traditional diabetes monitoring methods

Excited to work hands-on with physical robots
key_responsibilities: Design and implement software systems for large-scale robotic data collection
Build tools for visualization, auto-preprocessing, and auto-labeling of robot training data

Wrangle large volumes of video and sensor data
Collaborate with ML and hardware teams
